00001 # Name:    bgproc.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/13/2013
00004 # Brief:   Provides services for performing system and Tcl commands in
00005 #          the background.
00006 
00007 namespace eval bgproc {
00008 
00009   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00010 
00011   variable last_update     0
00012   variable update_interval 100
00013 
00014   array set resource_completed {
00015     all 0
00016   }
00017   array set resources    {}
00018   array set resource_pid {}
00019   array set resource_tmo {}
00020   array set cancelled    {}
00021 
00022   #############################################################
00023   #------------------------------------------------------------
00024   #  PUBLIC PROCEDURES
00025   #------------------------------------------------------------
00026   #############################################################
00027 
00028   #############################################################
00029   # This procedure should be called by the toplevel code when
00030   # it wants to wait for all pending commands to complete.
00031   # blocks until all background activity has completed.
00032   proc synchronize {{resource ""}} {
00033 
00034     variable resource_completed
00035     variable resources
00036 
00037     # Wait for the specified resource to complete
00038     if {$resource ne ""} {
00039 
00040       # If the given resource list is in existence, wait for it to complete.
00041       if {[info exists resources($resource)]} {
00042         if {![info exists resource_completed($resource)]} {
00043           set resource_completed($resource)] 0
00044         }
00045         vwait bgproc::resource_completed($resource)
00046       }
00047 
00048     # Wait for all resources to complete
00049     } else {
00050 
00051       # If we have any processes outstanding, wait for them to be completed.
00052       if {[array size resources] > 0} {
00053         vwait bgproc::resource_completed(all)
00054       }
00055 
00056     }
00057 
00058   }
00059 
00060   #############################################################
00061   # Calls the given system command in the background and guarantees
00062   # that it will complete before the GUI is shutdown.
00063   proc system {resource cmd args} {
00064 
00065     # Handle options
00066     array set opts {
00067       -cancelable   0
00068       -killable     0
00069       -releasable   0
00070       -callback     ""
00071       -readcallback ""
00072       -redirect     ""
00073       -timeout      0
00074       -variable     ""
00075     }
00076     array set opts $args
00077 
00078     # Push the resource
00079     push_resource $resource [array get opts] [list bgproc::system_helper $resource $cmd $opts(-callback) $opts(-readcallback) $opts(-redirect) $opts(-timeout) $opts(-variable)]
00080 
00081   }
00082 
00083   #############################################################
00084   # Calls the given Tcl command in the background and guarantees
00085   # that it will complete before the GUI is shutdown.
00086   proc command {resource cmd args} {
00087 
00088     # Handle options
00089     array set opts {
00090       -cancelable 0
00091       -callback   ""
00092     }
00093     array set opts $args
00094 
00095     # We cannot kill or release Tcl commands
00096     array set opts {
00097       -killable   0
00098       -releasable 0
00099     }
00100 
00101     # Push the resource
00102     push_resource $resource [array get opts] [list bgproc::command_helper $resource $cmd $opts(-callback)]
00103 
00104   }
00105 
00106   #############################################################
00107   # This procedure can be called from anywhere.  It calls the
00108   # update command if it hasn't been called within a specified
00109   # period of time.
00110   proc update {{initialize 0}} {
00111 
00112     variable last_update
00113     variable update_interval
00114     
00115     # Get the current time
00116     set curr_time [clock milliseconds]
00117     
00118     # If we are initializing, don't update
00119     if {$initialize} {
00120       set last_update $curr_time
00121 
00122     # If the difference between the last update time and the current time exceeds the 
00123     # maximum allowed update interval, perform the update and save the current time as
00124     # the last update time.
00125     } elseif {($curr_time - $last_update) >= $update_interval} {
00126       set last_update $curr_time
00127       ::update
00128     }
00129 
00130   }
00131 
00132   if {[string first wish [info nameofexecutable]] != -1} {
00133  
00134     #############################################################
00135     # Displays a progress dialog box that performs a local grab with
00136     # a potential cancel button (available if the resource is killable).
00137     proc progress_dialog {resource msg parent} {
00138 
00139       variable resources
00140       variable cancelled
00141 
00142       if {[llength $resources($resource)] > 0} {
00143 
00144         set w ".resourceprogwin[lsearch [array names resources] $resource]"
00145 
00146         if {![winfo exists $w]} {
00147 
00148           toplevel            $w -bd 2 -relief raised
00149           wm overrideredirect $w 1
00150           wm transient        $w $parent
00151           wm resizable        $w 0 0
00152 
00153           frame            $w.f
00154           label            $w.f.msg    -text $msg
00155           ttk::progressbar $w.f.pb     -orient horizontal -mode indeterminate
00156           button           $w.f.cancel -text [msgcat::mc "Cancel"] -command "set bgproc::cancelled($resource) 1; bgproc::killall $resource"
00157 
00158           grid columnconfigure $w.f 0 -weight 1
00159           grid $w.f.msg -row 0 -column 0 -sticky news -padx 2 -pady 2
00160           grid $w.f.pb  -row 1 -column 0 -sticky news -padx 2 -pady 2
00161           if {[lindex $resources($resource) 0 2]} {
00162             grid $w.f.cancel -row 0 -column 1 -sticky ews -rowspan 2 -padx 2 -pady 2
00163           }
00164 
00165           pack $w.f -fill both -expand yes
00166 
00167           # Place the window and set the focus/grab
00168           ::tk::PlaceWindow $w widget $parent
00169           ::tk::SetFocusGrab $w $w
00170 
00171           # Start the progress bar
00172           $w.f.pb start
00173 
00174           # Wait for the resource to complete
00175           synchronize $resource
00176 
00177           # Stop the progress bar
00178           $w.f.pb stop
00179 
00180           # Restore the focus and grab
00181           ::tk::RestoreFocusGrab $w $w
00182 
00183           # Return a value of 0 if we were cancelled
00184           if {[info exists cancelled($resource)]} {
00185             unset cancelled($resource)
00186             return 0
00187           }
00188 
00189         }
00190 
00191       }
00192 
00193       return 1
00194 
00195     }
00196 
00197   }

00201   #  INTERNAL PROCEDURES

00205   #############################################################
00206   # Gathers the command output from the given command channel.
00207   proc get_command_output {resource callback readcallback fid pid redirect_id var} {
00208 
00209     variable system_result
00210     variable resource_pid
00211     variable resource_tmo
00212 
00213     if {[eof $fid]} {
00214 
00215       # Change the file to blocking so that we can get error information from it - TBD
00216       fconfigure $fid -blocking 1
00217 
00218       # Close the channel
00219       if {[catch "close $fid" rc]} {
00220         set error_found         1
00221         set system_result($pid) $rc
00222         if {$var ne ""} {
00223           upvar #0 $var uvar
00224           set uvar ""
00225         }
00226       } else {
00227         set error_found 0
00228       }
00229 
00230       # Handle an I/O redirect
00231       if {$redirect_id ne ""} {
00232         catch "close $redirect_id"
00233       }
00234 
00235       # If we have a timeout mechanism set for our resource, cancel it.
00236       if {[info exists resource_tmo($resource)]} {
00237         after cancel $resource_tmo($resource)
00238         unset resource_tmo($resource)
00239       }
00240 
00241       # If we have a callback function to invoke, call it now
00242       if {[info exists resource_pid($resource)]} {
00243         unset resource_pid($resource)
00244         if {$callback ne ""} {
00245           if {[catch "$callback $error_found [list $system_result($pid)]" rc]} {
00246             bgerror $rc
00247           }
00248         }
00249         unset system_result($pid)
00250       }
00251 
00252       # Pop the current resource and handle any new jobs
00253       pop_resource $resource
00254 
00255     } elseif {[set data [read $fid]] ne ""} {
00256       if {$redirect_id ne ""} {
00257         puts -nonewline $redirect_id $data
00258       }
00259       if {$readcallback ne ""} {
00260         if {[catch "$readcallback [list $data]" rc]} {
00261           bgerror $rc
00262         }
00263       }
00264       append system_result($pid) $data
00265       if {$var ne ""} {
00266         upvar #0 $var uvar
00267         append uvar $data
00268       }
00269     }
00270 
00271   }
00272 
00273   #############################################################
00274   # Helper procedure for the system procedure.
00275   proc system_helper {resource cmd callback readcallback redirect timeout var} {
00276 
00277     variable system_result
00278     variable resources
00279     variable resource_pid
00280     variable resource_tmo
00281 
00282     # If we are killable and our resource queue is > 1, don't run ourself.
00283     if {![lindex $resources($resource) 0 2] || ([llength $resources($resource)] == 1)} {
00284 
00285       # Start the executable in the background
00286       if {[catch "open {| $cmd} r" cmd_id]} {
00287         if {$callback ne ""} {
00288           if {[catch "$callback 1 [list $cmd_id]" rc]} {
00289             bgerror $rc
00290           }
00291         } else {
00292           notifier::notify -type error -parent $::top_window \
00293             -message [msgcat::mc "Unable to run system command (%s)" $cmd] -detail $cmd_id
00294         }
00295         pop_resource $resource
00296         return
00297       }
00298 
00299       set pid                 [pid $cmd_id]
00300       set system_result($pid) ""
00301 
00302       # If a variable was specified, initialize it as well
00303       if {$var ne ""} {
00304         upvar #0 $var uvar
00305         set uvar ""
00306       }
00307 
00308       # Add our PID to the resources queue
00309       set resource_pid($resource) $pid
00310 
00311       # If we need to redirect the I/O, open the file
00312       set redirect_id ""
00313       if {$redirect ne ""} {
00314         set redirect_id [open $redirect a]
00315       }
00316 
00317       # Create a file handler to gather the return information
00318       fconfigure $cmd_id -blocking 0
00319       fileevent  $cmd_id readable [list bgproc::get_command_output $resource $callback $readcallback $cmd_id $pid $redirect_id $var]
00320 
00321       # If a timeout value was specified, kill the resource after the specified period of time
00322       if {$timeout > 0} {
00323         set resource_tmo($resource) [after $timeout [list bgproc::kill_pid $resource]]
00324       }
00325 
00326     } else {
00327 
00328       # Pop the current resource and handle any new jobs
00329       pop_resource $resource
00330 
00331     }
00332 
00333   }
00334 
00335   #############################################################
00336   # Interrupts the given PID and frees the resource_pid, if necessary.
00337   proc interrupt_pid {resource} {
00338   
00339     variable resource_pid
00340     variable resource_tmo
00341     
00342     if {[info exists resource_pid($resource)]} {
00343       if {![catch "exec kill -s INT $resource_pid($resource)" rc]} {
00344         unset resource_pid($resource)
00345       }
00346     }
00347     
00348     catch "unset resource_tmo($resource)"
00349   
00350   }
00351   
00352   #############################################################
00353   # Kills the given PID and frees the resource_pid, if necessary.
00354   proc kill_pid {resource} {
00355 
00356     variable resource_pid
00357     variable resource_tmo
00358 
00359     if {[info exists resource_pid($resource)]} {
00360       if {![catch "exec kill -9 $resource_pid($resource)" rc]} {
00361         unset resource_pid($resource)
00362       }
00363     }
00364 
00365     catch "unset resource_tmo($resource)"
00366 
00367   }
00368 
00369   #############################################################
00370   # Helper procedure for the command proc.
00371   proc command_helper {resource cmd {callback ""}} {
00372 
00373     # Perform the command
00374     set retval [eval $cmd]
00375 
00376     # If we have a callback function to invoke, call it now
00377     if {$callback ne ""} {
00378       eval "$callback [list $retval]"
00379     }
00380 
00381     # Pop the current resource and handle any new jobs
00382     pop_resource $resource
00383 
00384   }
00385 
00386   #############################################################
00387   # Kills/removes all resources from the given resource queue
00388   # pattern.  Returns 1 if a process was successfully killed; 
00389   # otherwise, returns 0.
00390   proc killall {{pattern *}} {
00391 
00392     variable resources
00393     variable resource_pid
00394 
00395     set retval 0
00396     
00397     foreach resource [array names resources $pattern] {
00398     
00399       if {[info exists resources($resource)] && [lindex $resources($resource) 0 2]} {
00400 
00401         if {[info exists resource_pid($resource)]} {
00402 
00403           # Kill the resource at the beginning of the queue
00404           if {![catch "exec kill -9 $resource_pid($resource)"]} {
00405             unset resource_pid($resource)
00406           }
00407 
00408         }
00409 
00410         # Clear out the rest of the entries in the given resource list
00411         if {[llength $resources($resource)] > 1} {
00412           set resources($resource) [lrange $resources($resource) 1 end]
00413         }
00414 
00415         set retval 1
00416 
00417       }
00418       
00419     }
00420     
00421     return $retval
00422 
00423   }
00424 
00425   #############################################################
00426   # Releases any resources that are releasable.
00427   proc releaseall {} {
00428 
00429     variable resources
00430     variable resource_pid
00431 
00432     foreach resource [array names resources] {
00433       if {[llength [set resources($resource) [lsearch -not -all -inline -index 3 $resources($resource) 1]]] == 0} {
00434         unset resources($resource)
00435       }
00436     }
00437 
00438   }
00439 
00440   #############################################################
00441   # Adds a given resource to its resource queue and runs the head
00442   # queue, if its the only one.
00443   proc push_resource {resource popts cmd} {
00444 
00445     variable resources
00446     variable resource_pid
00447 
00448     array set opts $popts
00449 
00450     # Add the command call to the associated resource queue
00451     lappend resources($resource) [list $cmd $opts(-cancelable) $opts(-killable) $opts(-releasable)]
00452 
00453     # Call the system helper, if we are the only thing in the resource queue, run it now
00454     if {[llength $resources($resource)] == 1} {
00455       after 1 [lindex $resources($resource) 0 0]
00456 
00457     # If the command at the head of the queue is killable, kill it now
00458     } elseif {[lindex $resources($resource) 0 2] && [info exists resource_pid($resource)]} {
00459 
00460       # Attempt to kill the job
00461       if {![catch "exec kill -9 $resource_pid($resource)"]} {
00462         unset resource_pid($resource)
00463       }
00464 
00465     }
00466 
00467   }
00468 
00469   #############################################################
00470   # Pops the given resource and starts the next job, if one exists.
00471   proc pop_resource {resource} {
00472 
00473     variable resources
00474     variable resource_completed
00475 
00476     # Pop ourselves off of the resource queue and start the next, if there is something
00477     set resources($resource) [lrange $resources($resource) 1 end]
00478 
00479     # Start the next command if one exists
00480     if {[llength $resources($resource)] > 0} {
00481 
00482       # Pop any cancelable events (except for the last one)
00483       while {([llength $resources($resource)] > 1) && [lindex $resources($resource) 0 1]} {
00484         set resources($resource) [lrange $resources($resource) 1 end]
00485       }
00486 
00487       # Run the command
00488       after 1 [lindex $resources($resource) 0 0]
00489 
00490     } else {
00491 
00492       unset resources($resource)
00493       set resource_completed($resource) 1
00494 
00495       # If the resource array is empty, specify that all current processes have completed
00496       if {[array size resources] == 0} {
00497         set resource_completed(all) 1
00498       }
00499 
00500     }
00501 
00502   }
00503 
00504 }
